abstract: An article on Friday about newly revealed testimony by Kenneth D. Lewis, the chairman of Bank of America, related to the bank’s acquisition of Merrill Lynch misspelled the surname of a lawyer who commented on the testimony. He is Randall W. Bodner, not Bonder.
snippet: An article on Friday about newly revealed testimony by Kenneth D. Lewis, the chairman of Bank of America, related to the bank’s acquisition of Merrill Lynch misspelled the surname of a lawyer who commented on the testimony. He is Randall W. Bodner...
lead_paragraph: An article on Friday about newly revealed testimony by Kenneth D. Lewis, the chairman of Bank of America, related to the bank’s acquisition of Merrill Lynch misspelled the surname of a lawyer who commented on the testimony. He is Randall W. Bodner, not Bonder.

abstract: Detroit, which could lose an automaker to bankruptcy, hopes to console itself with a big piece of the legal action, The New York Times’s Jonathan D. Glater and Micheline Maynard reported.
lead_paragraph: Detroit, which could lose an automaker to bankruptcy, hopes to console itself with a big piece of the legal action, The New York Times’s Jonathan D. Glater and Micheline Maynard reported.

headline.main: Detroit Courts Vie to Host Potential Auto Bankruptcies

abstract: Alan D. Schwartz, the former chief executive of Bear Stearns, appears to be heading to Goldman Sachs, Fortune magazine reports.
snippet: Alan D. Schwartz, the former chief executive of Bear Stearns, appears to be heading to Goldman Sachs, Fortune magazine reports.
lead_paragraph: Since the fall of Bear Stearns in March 2008, Alan D. Schwartz, the firm’s chief executive, has been notably missing in action. Mr. Schwartz, a mergers and acquisitions banker, had the misfortune of taking charge of Bear just two months before it collapsed.

headline.main: Bear Stearns Ex-Chief Said to Be in Talks With Goldman
